name: Anti-Dumping Duties Rules, 2014 Amendment
content:
ettlette REGISTERED No. M  - 302 
L.-7646 
of Fabian 
EXTRAORDINARY 
PUBLISHED BY AUTHORITY 
ISLAMABAD, THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 6, 2014 
PART II 
Statutory Notifications (S.R.0.) 
GOVERNMENT OF PAKISTAN 
MINISTRY OF COMMERCE AND TEXTILE INDUSTRY 
NOTIFICATION 
Islamabad, the 4th February, 2014 
S.R.O. 84 (I)/2014.—In exercise of the powers conferred by section 67 
of the Anti-Dumping Duties Ordinance, 2000 (LXV of 2000), the Federal 
Government is pleased to direct that the following further amendments shall be 
made in the Anti-Dumping Duties Rules, 2001, namely:— 
In the aforesaid Rules:— 
in rule 6, for the words "contain adequate information on" the words 
"set forth on otherwise make available through a separate report" 
shall be substituted; 
in rule 10, for the words "also contain" the words "set forth or 
otherwise make available through a separate report" shall be 
substituted; 
(239) 
Price : Rs. 02.00 
[4123 (2014)/Ex. Gaz.] 
• 	240 	THE GALLI l'h OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., FEBRUARY 6,2014 	[PARTII  
(c) 	in rule 15, for the commas and words ", in addition to the information 
required under the Ordinance, contain" the words "set forth or 
otherwise make available through a separate report" shall be 
substituted; and 
(d) 	in rule 20,— 
for the words "shall be in the amount set out" the words "and 
publication charges in an investigation shall be set out" shall be 
substituted; and 
for full stop at the end a colon shall be substituted and thereafter 
the following proviso shall be added, namely:- 
"Provide that— 
all expenses for publication of notices in the newspapers 
in an investigation shall be borne by the applicant on actual 
basis; 
for the purpose of publication charges, approximate amount 
determined by the Commission shall be deposited by the 
applicant, with the Commission in the form of post dated 
cheque, bank draft or pay order at the time of submission 
of the Application; and 
subject to clause (a), the post dated cheque, bank draft or 
pay order shall be adjusted and, if any, returned to the 
Applicant on conclusion of the investigation.; and 
(e) 	in the Second Schedule, for the figure "75,000" the figure "100,000" 
shall be substituted. 
[F. No. 3 (45)/201.2-VVT01 
NIAZ MUHAMMAD KHAN, 
Deputy Secretary (WTO). 
PRINTED BY THE MANAGER, PRINTING CORPORATION OF PAKISTAN PRESS, ISLAMABAD. 
PUBUSHED BY THE DEPUTY CONTROLLER, STATIONERY AND FORMS, UNIVERSITY ROAD, KARACHI.
